A ServiceNow-based peer-to-peer rental application that enables users to:

  1. Register and create personal profiles with contact and location details.
  2. List items available for rent with a daily rate and caution deposit.
  3. Search and view available items by category, proximity and filters related to condition and price.
  4. Contact item owners and manage rental transactions securely. 

This initiative promotes resource sharing, affordability, and sustainability, helping reduce unnecessary consumption and fostering a culture of reuse.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: In today’s consumer-driven society, many individuals purchase specialized and expensive gear/equipment for short-term or one-time use according to their needs. This leads to impulsive buying, clutter, and increased environmental waste. There is a lack of a unified platform where individuals can securely, locally, and transparently rent or lend items, with clear rental terms and caution deposits, ensuring mutual benefit and promoting sustainability.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow Studio: For creating and managing the custom application (tables, scripts, UI components). 

Service Portal / Now Mobile App: Provides a modern, user-friendly interface for browsing and managing rental listings as well as on phone.

Flow Designer: Automates core workflows such as rental requests, approvals, payment notifications, and return confirmations. 

Now Assist (GenAI): Summarizes user reviews, provides feedback scores, and recommends improvements to listings. 

ACLs: Secure item and user records and fields based on roles like renter, consumer.

REST APIs and Integration Hub: Used to connect with external APIs (payment, messaging, national ID authentication). 

Reports and Dashboard: Track rental activity and metrics, and a dashboard to monitor rental requests.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Proposed solution will rely on several external technologies, APIs, and tools to ensure smooth operation-

  1. Payment Gateway API- For collecting caution deposits and daily rental charges securely. 
  2. National ID Provider API- For authenticating the national ID number
  3. Digital Signature API- For users to digitally sign rental agreements. etc.
  4. Natural Language Processing API- To summarize user feedback and generate listing insights or quality scores. 
  5. Fraud Detection API- Detects suspicious activity like fake listings or repeated cancellations.
  6. Option for inclusion of Logistics & Delivery services during later stage of the product.

 

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Integrating with external payment gateways (Razorpay, PayPal, etc.) securely can be tricky.

  2. Handling refunds of deposits, transaction failures, and partial payments requires careful workflow and API management.

  3. Handling disputes (e.g., item damage, non-returns) requires additional business logic and governance.
  4. Storing personal user data (address, contact details, ID proofs) and financial information (deposits, payments) must comply with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR).
